question: An increasing number of people are buying what they need online. What are the advantages and disadvantages for both individual and companies shopping online .
text: The figures comparing how much the expatriates spent for (a) the cost of living in Hong Kong and (other
seven) six other cities in 2000 and 2001 are given in the bar chart, while the pie chart provides
information of areas of spending for expatriate families. Overall, it can be seen that the cost of living in
Tokyo compared to Hong Kong is the most expensive in both time periods, (compared to the other six
cities) and housing is the highest expenditure.
To begin with the cities that have higher cost of living than Hong Kong, in 2000, the cost of living in
Tokyo was almost 100% higher compared to Hong Kong, then the number dropped dramatically by
around 30% in the following year, whereas New York and London started from around 20% and then
increased slight (increased) by around 5% for New York and less than 3% for London in the next year.
Moving on to Singapore, Shanghai, Taipei which have the lower living expenses, in Singapore living
expenses remained stable in both time periods, which was lower than Hong Kong by approximately 10%.
Living expenses in Shanghai were cheaper by around 20% in 2000 and increased by approximately 5% in
the following year, Taipei, on the other hand, was 10% lower in 2001 and dropped by around 5% at the
Turning to the pie chart, the largest proportion that the expatriates and family spent was housing at
34%, while alcohol and tobacco had the smallest proportion at 4%, the remaining categories ranged
from 5% for misc. to 15% for transport.

error_list.error_des: It seems that preposition use may be incorrect here.
It appears that you are missing a comma after the introductory phrase To begin with. Consider adding a comma.
The noun phrase higher cost seems to be missing a determiner before it. Consider adding an article.
It appears that you are missing a comma or two with the interrupter whereas New York and London. Consider adding the comma(s).
It seems that conjunction use may be incorrect here.
The plural verb have does not appear to agree with the singular subject Taipei. Consider changing the verb form for subject-verb agreement.
It seems that preposition use may be incorrect here.
It seems that this noun form may be incorrect.
It seems that family may not agree in number with other words in this phrase.
